LTM not working in Pieces CLI
Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Installation/Startup Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues installing or starting Pieces OS and the desktop application across different operating systems (Linux, macOS, Chromebook). Problems include Chromebook installation issues with unresponsive buttons, startup errors on Linux related to graphics drivers ("Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format"), and LTM repeatedly turning off on macOS after updating to version 11.4.2.  Further investigation into platform-specific compatibility and software stability is needed.

related_issues.title: Installation issue in cromebook
related_issues.text:
Installation issue in cromebook
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.1.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There are some issues with the Chromebook. When installing core dependencies, the screen flickers, and it takes a long time to buffer. Once loaded, you can't click any buttons, like the "Get Started" button. It just gets stuck on that page.
also it has issue with full screen you can to anything unless minimize

related_issues.title: Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format
related_issues.text:
Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format
### Software

Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Whenever I am trying to start Pieces OS or Pieces For Developers via the Linux Terminal, or via VS Code Plug-In (I don't use / haven't tried other ways), the following error message appears:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3b7cc5de-7fdd-4a36-99f2-c806a7e540d6)


Information about my system:

```
inxi -G
Graphics:
  Device-1: NVIDIA GP107 [GeForce GTX 1050 Ti] driver: nvidia v: 535.183.01
  Display: x11 server: X.Org v: 1.21.1.7 with: Xwayland v: 22.1.9 driver: X:
    loaded: nvidia unloaded: fbdev,modesetting,nouveau,vesa gpu: nvidia
    resolution: 1680x1050~60Hz
  API: OpenGL v: 4.6.0 NVIDIA 535.183.01 renderer: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050
    Ti/PCIe/SSE2
```

```
uname -a
Linux debian 6.1.0-25-amd64 #1 SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Debian 6.1.106-3 (2024-08-26) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

Thanks in a advance!

related_issues.title: bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
related_issues.text:
bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I just updated Pieces to try out L.T.M 2.5, and I noticed that the software keeps stopping and restarting on its own. I checked for any updates I may have missed, and none. I restarted the software by forcing it to quit, but the issue persisted. 

The issue only happens when I turn on L.T.M. 
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: LTM connection issues across Pieces OS and CLI
common_issues.description: Users report LTM functionality is intermittently unavailable or completely inaccessible in both the Pieces CLI and Desktop app.  Issues include CLI failing to retrieve context from LTM, Desktop app repeatedly turning off LTM, and error messages related to unavailable configurations or model access.  Users have tried updating Pieces and restarting the application, but the problems persist across different OS versions (11.0.3 - 11.4.2) and platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux).

related_issues.title: LTM not working in Pieces CLI
related_issues.text:
LTM not working in Pieces CLI
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces CLI, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Screenshot from CLI:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/949b363d-bbd3-4f3a-b128-5211ca2ef765)

Same question from a chat in Pieces Desktop instead:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d3e98a3-e311-46d3-acba-678e286a4bcd)

Pieces CLI doesn't seem to get the context from LTM.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving LTM connection issues across the Pieces CLI and Desktop app, given its recurrence and impact on user workflows.

Investigate and address the root causes of Pieces OS and Desktop app installation/startup issues across different operating systems (Linux, macOS, Chromebook), focusing on Chromebook's unresponsive buttons, Linux startup graphics driver errors, and macOS LTM stability.
Improve LTM stability on macOS, specifically addressing the issue where LTM repeatedly turns off after updating to version 11.4.2.
Review and update documentation or provide clearer error messages related to LTM unavailability and model access issues.
Consider creating platform-specific troubleshooting guides for installation and startup issues to assist users experiencing problems on different operating systems.
Monitor and address the graphics driver compatibility issue on Linux causing the "Starting error: No available configurations for the given RGBA pixel format" to prevent further user frustration.
Investigate the Chromebook installation process, particularly the reported screen flickering, slow buffering, and unresponsive buttons, to ensure a smooth user experience.
Gather more data on the frequency and specific circumstances under which LTM turns off on macOS to pinpoint the root cause and implement a permanent fix.
Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds to users through release notes, blog posts, or in-app notifications to manage expectations and reduce support ticket volume.
Analyze user feedback and support tickets to identify any other recurring issues or trends that may require attention and prioritization in future development cycles.
Implement better error handling and logging within the Pieces CLI and Desktop app to capture more detailed information about LTM connection failures, facilitating faster debugging and resolution.
Explore potential improvements to the LTM onboarding process to ensure users understand how to properly configure and utilize the feature, minimizing user errors and support requests.
Consider implementing automated tests to cover installation and startup scenarios across different operating systems to catch compatibility issues early in the development process.
Investigate the possibility of providing alternative installation methods for Chromebook users if the current method continues to present challenges.
Evaluate the feasibility of offering a diagnostics tool within the Pieces app to help users identify and troubleshoot common issues, reducing the need for direct support interaction.
Enhance communication between the development team and support staff to ensure timely updates and information sharing regarding known issues, bug fixes, and planned improvements.
Track the resolution rate and time-to-resolution for LTM-related issues to measure the effectiveness of implemented solutions and identify areas for further optimization.
Analyze user activity data to understand how users are interacting with LTM and identify any usage patterns that may contribute to connection issues or instability.
Consider implementing a user feedback mechanism within the Pieces app to allow users to easily report bugs, suggest improvements, and provide valuable insights for future development.
Regularly review and update the knowledge base and FAQ section with solutions to common issues and troubleshooting steps to empower users to self-serve and reduce support ticket volume.
